Is foam board the best backing for photo framing?

All pictures that are framed demand some form of backing content to deliver rigidity and protection. Even stretched canvasses that are unframed should really have some backing to protect against dust making up on the back of the painting. When dust accumulates it allows lure moisture which then promotes mould development which in change triggers deterioration to the artwork.

Photograph framers have utilized several varieties of backing board about the decades. Foam board or foamcore boards have turn out to be a single of the most popular option just lately because of to their mild-excess weight construction, rigidity and easy cutting. They replaced the cardboard, Masonite or MDF (medium density fiber-board) that framers had come to be accustomed to working with but are they improved than their counterparts.

What typically fears framers most is the chemical compounds that can leach from the backing into the photograph. Picture framers often converse about acid-free of charge, lignin-absolutely free or one hundred% cotton rag in their presentation to clients. The dangerous substances in non acid-free of charge supplies can cause staining and acid burn up to prints, posters and artworks that they arrive into contact with. Sometimes layers of security like barrier papers, mounting boards or polyester sheeting is positioned between the backing and the photo. It is far superior to eliminate the resource of the harmful substances than to just check out to sluggish down their migration into the artwork.

There are acid-free and cotton surfaced foam boards which are sold as conservation foam board but these are to be made use of with caution when employed as a direct backing for artwork. Just one type of foam board manufactured by Gilman USA is a hundred% plastic and could be regarded as a conservation board but you would however ordinarily add one more layer of one hundred% cotton rag board or an alpha-cellulose board as a barrier. Lots of galleries prefer to use corflute because of to its affordable charge and again currently being a plastic products lignins are not existing. Other conservation backings incorporate smooth surface area coated corrugated boards that are created from alpha-cellulose. A new advancement in the manufacturing of E-flute core board, exactly where there is a double laminated corrugated core faced with white acid-no cost surface papers, is eagerly waited for by the framing community.

Utilizing plastic primarily based boards can have other results that require to be thoroughly weighed up depending on the artwork remaining framed.
